posts.title: #219 Chinese Translation of GDevelop 5 (1) | ✍ GDevelop 5 中文翻译（一）
posts.text: Repository GitHub: https://github.com/4ian/GDevelop Crowdin: https://crowdin.com/project/gdevelop Simplified Chinese: https://crowdin.com/project/gdevelop/zh-CN# Project Details ##GDevelop is an open-source, cross-platform game creator. It doesn’t require any programming skills, so it’s easy to use. Anyone can use GDevelop to create 2D games, such as platformers, puzzles, shoot ‘em up, strategy, 8-bit games… It can be simple projects for fun or more ambitious indie games. Events is a unique feature of GDevelop. It’s a powerful way to express the logic of your game without a programming language. Users can publish games created with GDevelop to the web, iOS, Android, Windows, Mac, Linux and even Facebook Messenger. Games can also be exported in one click to Android from the app. GDevelop also offers visual editors to prototype new features, and the game engine can be extended with Javascript. Tutorials, examples and a complete documentation for the software are available. As a wonderful opportunity to teach programming and game making, GDevelop has already been used in classrooms and online courses, with digital media students or children in first grade. ## Image Source: https://gdevelop-app.com ##Before I started the translation of GDevelop, I first read through the project on Crowdin and in GitHub. Except for the GDevelop 5 I’m translating, their website is to be translated. This project’s user-friendly and creative features interests me. I believe it’s a great tool that helps people without any programming knowledge turn their ideas into reality. Sounds exciting, doesn’t it? Hopefully my translation in Simplified Chinese bring more users to this platform. I’d love to see the large number of Chinese makers and educators benefit from this tool. So they can unleash their creativity to build games or programmes, and inspire students to do so as well. Contribution Specifications ##Translation Overview As you can see from the screenshots below, this project consists of 2 files - GDevelop 5 (editor) and GDevelop (core and extensions). The second file has been translated partly by others. I started from the first file at 0%, and finished 36% (1,054 of 2,906 words) in my first submission. Before: ⬇️ After: ##Different from the whole context of Quasar Framework documentation, the GDevelop 5 file includes short independent strings about the game editor. It took less time in translating each string, but sometimes it’s more difficult to opt for an accurate Chinese word choice due to the lack of a complete picture. I truly appreciate the help from my proofreader @aafeng, who has always been very patient and helpful. He examined my translation work promptly and suggested a few changes. I’m looking forward to working on the left part of this file, as well as finishing the second part - core and extensions. ##Languages I translate from English to Simplified Chinese. ##Word Count I have translated 1054 words in this submission: ##Proof of Authorship My translation activities can be viewed in my Crowdin profile: https://crowdin.com/profile/Donica/activity This page is synchronized from the post: ‘#219 Chinese Translation of GDevelop 5 (1) | ✍ GDevelop 5 中文翻译（一）’ document.querySelectorAll('.not-gallery-item') .forEach(el => { if (!el.dataset.src) { return; } const img = document.createElement('img'); img.style = 'display:none !important;'; img.src = el.dataset.src; img.addEventListener('error', () => { img.remove(); el.style.color = 'inherit'; el.style.backgroundImage = 'none'; el.style.background = 'none'; }); img.addEventListener('load', () => { img.remove(); }); document.body.appendChild(img); });

I like its tagline: Wonders are collectible.店名：“奇特的生物”（我从法语翻译过来的，可能不准确。我的感觉是里面有卖一些奇特的动物标本、书、文具等，然后买那些奇特的小玩意儿的人也是些奇特的生物。挺好的，这个世界已经够多无趣的循规蹈矩了不是吗。）下面一排小字：“奇迹是可以收藏的。”.JPG) ##.jpg) ##.jpg) ##.jpg) ##Some cool “special” books: ;)门口的书就很奇特，我挺喜欢这些无厘头的幽默感，还有不少环保的绿色书籍也很棒(Hi @dancingapple~ 可能你不在，但不妨碍我突然想起你的召唤 :p)：.JPG) ##The poet Donald Trump and the life coach Vladimir Putin, lol…《川普总统的美妙诗集》，《成功学导师普京总统》…… 呵呵呵：.jpg) ##Hi @liltammy, our Frida Kahlo here~ :D.jpg) ##I was thinking about buying these plant books as well, but since they were too heavy to carry, I only bought the other 2 small ones at last. ;)其实也很想买这几本绿植的书，但太重了懒得背，最后只买了其他两样轻巧的小册子。=）.JPG) ##看到这本Cacti，想到我养了好几个月的几小盆多肉竟然都还健在，哈哈哈：.JPG) ##Pretty classic literature books:名著也精美：.JPG) ##Love these minimal planner, to do lists and notebooks:简简单单的便笺、记事本，可惜年前已经买过类似的，不忍再剁手。:).jpg) ##What I bought at last:最后我买的 —— 《艺术啊它如何让人开心》（看着名字和颜色、装帧我就已经很开心，哈哈）的小书和一套古风地图贴纸，好开心~ .jpg) ##I just adore things with a map on them, and they are stickers! :)刚来时的第一篇自我介绍里说过，所有印有地图的东西都能让我热血沸腾，现在有了这些可爱的贴纸，地图真的可以无处不在了，哈哈哈：.jpg) .jpg) .jpg) ##How art can make you happy?小书的内里。一直觉得灰色和黄色很搭，低调平和又不失活泼明快，世界各地住过的家里都有很多这种色彩组合的家具和小物件。.jpg) .jpg) .jpg) ##So that’s it for this little shop during my walk. posts.title: #224 Quiet Misty Evening | 暮 · 雾
posts.text: ##Just a quiet misty evening in the south of Chile. I captured this scene during a business trip 2 years ago. It’s early April, autumn time in the southern hemisphere. Quite chilly in that region. It’s difficult to describe the unique atmosphere then. Once again words fail me. Thank god I had a camera. Hopefully you can feel it from my picture. Below is the photo in color. Which do you prefer? posts.title: #227 5-Minute Freewrite: Shining Like Gold 🌟 | 金闪闪的故事
posts.text: ##Greetings everyone! I’m joining the portrait photo contest with the head picture I took in Sri Lanka. And here’s another reason I chose the photo: I saw @mariannewest’s Tuesday prompt for the 5 Minute Freewrite is GOLD. It reminds me of this cute little girl who dressed in goldish and stood in front of some goldish saree (see the second photo below). Plus her smile in the sun, together with her sweetness and intelligence made her shine like gold. :) It’s my first time participating this Freewrite challenge, and I’m not sure if the paragraphs I’m writing in 5 minutes would meet the requirement. But it’s fun to try. If you haven’t known about this awesome daily writing challenge, feel free to check it out and join in too! So I met this GOLD girl during my travels in the tea country in Sri Lanka. I took a train from the capital city and had a few stopovers on my way. Her hometown is one of the villages I stopped by. Her mother was running a small guest house which was part of their own home. She was the youngest daughter in the family, and welcomed me when I arrived at their hillside home from the train station. She helped me register my passport info and showed me around their house. Her mother offered me some sweets and the local tea (of course ;)), and went on with her housework. So the little girl and I had a very pleasant conversation full of laughter, about her studies at school, the famous local tea, their village, my travels in her country and other random stuff. I know, seems I could enjoy talking with a 7 year-old as well as a 70 one. ;) On the wall of their living room, lots of her certificates of merit and event photos from school were displayed. Apparently she’s a smart and talented girl. And it’s proved soon. After I checked into my room, I found that the socket on the wall didn’t work for charging. So I walked downstairs to tell the girl’s mother about it. Before she replied, this GOLD girl came to the rescue. She grabbed a pencil and said:”Follow me.” After a few attempts with the magical pencil, the socket worked again. Sweet, wasn’t it? ## ##Later, when I stepped out of the house for a walk in town, I saw her helping her mom put up the golden saree for drying. Hearing my steps, she turned around and smiled to me, standing in the sun, shining like gold. ##大家好~ 这篇的照片用来参加人像摄影活动，是我在斯里兰卡的茶乡拍的。这个充满灵气的小姑娘是我入住的当地一户人家的小女儿，非常聪明可爱，跟我相谈甚欢没错，我跟上至70下至7岁的人都可以无话不谈;)，还用一支神奇的铅笔帮我修好了房间的插座。 文字部分的小故事围绕5分钟自由写作活动给出的当日主题“金”。上面英文有提到相关主办人，感兴趣的朋友也来参加吧！=) All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #111 Sunset over Glass House Mountains - The Spiritual Home of Aboriginal Australians ⛰🇦🇺 日落土著群山
posts.text: Hey fellow Steemians, have you heard of Glass House Mountains in Queensland, Australia? What you see in the head image is the splendid sunset over this area. Now follow my post for more sunset shots from here and the story behind these mountains! =) 大家好！今天请跟我来看看澳大利亚昆士兰州的玻璃屋群山。日落时分，空中的云朵仿佛被老天打翻的调色盘染上了色彩，绮丽缤纷，我当时看到立刻掏出手机来了一张，于是便有了题图。 ##I first noticed these peaks on the way from Brisbane to Sunshine Coast. The landscape outside was dominantly coastal plains covered with green trees and plants, then out of a sudden, a few rugged peaks rose abruptly from nowhere. Hmmm, interesting. I immediately checked the map on my phone to see what they are. So these are Glass House Mountains - 13 dramatic peaks formed by volcanic activity that occurred 26 to 27 million years ago. The highest hill is called Mount Beerwah, sitting at 556 metres above sea level. It is seen as the mother hill, and Mount Tibrogargan is the father of the left 11 peaks. Among the son and daughter hills, the eldest brother is Mount Coonowrin. How lovely - it is a big family of hills! :D See some spiritual connection here? Yes, the traditional owners of this area are the Aboriginals - Jinibara and Gubbi Gubbi people. They used to gather in their spiritual home here for ceremonies and trading, and many of their ceremonial sites are still present today. Due to their cultural significance, the Glass House Mountains are listed on the Queensland and National heritage registers as a landscape of national importance. After exploring the whole region of the Sunny Coast, we moved to this cooler and greener hinterland. I feel so lucky to have this spectacular view almost daily on the way to work and back. I never get tired of it. It’s not just a feast of endless green landscape to the eyes, but also the feeling of spirituality to the mind. It is kind of magical. =) Especially when the sun is setting, the vast land appears more mysterious against all the brilliant colors of the sky. You might wonder if you can get close to this big family of hills? Yes, three of them are open to the public for bushwalking and climbing: the mother Mount Beerwah, the father Mount Tibrogargan and one of their children - Mount Ngungun. :) Hiking on the easy or challenging walking tracks through open forests is rewarding when you end up at the lookouts offering amazing panoramic views. We also love driving along the 55-kilometre Blackall Range Tourist Drive, just north of the Glass House Mountains. This is such a scenic drive on the winding country roads. Imagine the fresh mountain air, and the views all the way back to the beaches on the coast! ❤ If you want to get more active, try rock climbing, kayaking or horse-riding. Or even more adventurous, have yourself abseiling a 50-metre drop - feel the heartbeat of yourself and the heartbeat from this wild land! Catching a train ride is always fun too! The historic rail network in this area has stations dating back to the 1890s, and the tracks were first laid for transporting timber. The steam trains are now replaced by modern ones though. You can pick up a map at the Glass House Mountains Visitor and Interpretive Centre, where you can learn about attractions and their history, and buy local products such as honey and jam. The hinterland region is home to farms growing pineapples, strawberries, avocados and macadamias. There are stalls selling fresh produce along the roads. Like in the black forest of Germany, you only need to leave coins in “honesty boxes” for your purchase. ##So that’s it for today, hope you like the sunset views and the story behind these mountains? Come visit this beautiful hinterland when you get a chance! You will love it! :) ##All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 My post is inspired by @aaronli’s A City a Story photo contest themed “Sunset”. Also, @kimzwarch and his team is running a cool project – Archisteem & Placestoremember. Check out their pages and join the fun! Thank you for reading. Please tell me what you think in the comments. posts.title: #231 Tagliatelle with Prawns 🍝 | 蜜糖 & 砒霜
posts.text: ##Hey, this is my dinner today - tagliatelle with prawns. I had this in a ski resort in the Austrian Alps. It’s my entry to @qurator’s Tasty Tuesday competition. ## ##这是我今天的晚餐 —— 虾仁意面，在奥地利滑雪的阿尔卑斯小山村的一家餐馆点的。一端上来觉得卖相还不错，就拍了两张照片。然鹅，吃到嘴里才发现不是我喜欢的味道，主料都寡淡无味，而奶酪奶油却过于浓稠地喧宾夺主。 当然，这里是山区，那些红肉山珍类的才是主打，特别是伴有蘑菇肉汁的主菜，料理好的话可以让人回味无穷、唇齿留香。 谁让我不知趣地想吃海鲜，还是伴着非本土的意呆利宽面…… 碰运气失败，其实也在意料之中，中西欧这边的很多菜都非常腻，奶酪奶油就跟不要钱似地狂加，常常盖过了食物本身的鲜美。我还是偏爱意大利西班牙葡萄牙那边海鲜面/饭的清爽原味。 但是我吃不惯，不意味着别人也不喜欢。好多次跟法国比利时荷兰德国瑞士等地方的人聚餐，他们都是各种粘稠奶酪奶油拌出来的东西吃得津津有味，超市饭店的主食里黏乎乎的浓白汤汁也常占去大半壁江山。就像我曾经觉得不吃辣的人简直错失人生一大乐趣呀，而不吃辣的人也觉得我干嘛没事自虐啊。你之蜜糖，我之砒霜。 ##又想起穿越西伯利亚的途中，在俄罗斯的伊尔库茨克停留了几天，其中一天，我和当地的host还有他的一位非洲朋友一起开车去看大名鼎鼎的贝加尔湖。在一望无际的湖边，那位高大威猛的黑人哥们儿教我们玩他随身携带的摇摆平衡软板。我看他很有运动天赋，觉得他大概跟我一样也喜欢户外活动、喜欢亲密接触大自然。 所以，接着聊到周边的森林时，我问他：“你喜欢徒步吗？” 他愣了一下，随即笑得前仰后合，上气不接下气地说：“姑娘，我们黑人的字典里没有 ‘徒步’ 这个词，我就从来没有徒过步。” 那一刻，我的内心是震（醍醐）惊（灌顶）的，震惊的不是知道了黑人原来不徒步这位兄台，我也见过徒步的黑人好吗，只是细想一下确实很少，震惊的是为什么我会无知到窃以为天下人都徒步呢？毕竟，世界如此广阔，喜好如此繁多。 All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #232 Spring is in the air! (2) 🌸 | 春（二）
posts.text: ##Greetings everyone! Following my previous post of Spring is in the air!(1) with loads of flower photos I took, here I’m sharing another type of spring flower - cherry blossom. It’s my entry to Qurator’s Photo Friday competition and Flamingirl’s  FLOWER POWER PHOTO CONTEST. Do you know an obvious difference between the cherry flower and the plum/peach flower? As you can see from the emoji and my photos, cherry blossoms’ petals have a cleft at the tip, while the other 2 don’t. At least, this is some unique feature that I observe to tell them part. =) Besides, cherry blossoms have longer stems than peach blossoms, and plum blossoms literally have no stems as they grow out from the branch itself. ## ## ##I found these trees near my home in Belgium during a cycling trip. They are full of gorgeous white to pink blossoms. Cherry blossoms have a short life of around two weeks, and are in full bloom in spring time, so they are a symbol of the spring and the fleeting nature of life. ## ## ##When I was taking pictures of these flowers a few days ago, the blossoms already started to fall, so the ground under the trees was covered by a carpet of soft petals. One man working in his garden nearby saw me and greeted me: “Hey, are you from Japan? I believe these flowers are from Japan.” :) I told him I’m not, but cherry blossom trees and their blossoms (Sakura) do play an important role in Japanese culture. Each spring, my friends who live in Japan would show me photos and videos of people enjoying Hanami (cherry blossom viewing) picnic party. During their national flower’s bloom season, Japanese people celebrate this old tradition with friends, families and co-workers underneath the cherry trees. ##Do you have cherry blossom trees where you live? Are they in full bloom right now? ## ## ## ## ##这是我在比利时住处附近拍的樱花。你最喜欢哪一张呢？ All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! Please tell me what you think. posts.title: #233 Desert Flowers (1) 🌸 | 沙漠之花（一）
posts.text: ##Hey everyone! Today I’m sharing some flower photos I shot in the Atacama desert region of Chile. Most part of the Atacama Desert is situated on the Pacific coast of Chile, west of the Andes mountains. This area is one of the driest places as well as the only true desert in the world to receive less precipitation than the polar deserts. The average annual rainfall here is about 15 mm (0.6 in), although some weather stations have never received rain. ## ##In spite of the extreme conditions of the desert, some flowers like the white one in my pictures are still blooming. This small slim flower might not be as pretty as many other types, but what an extraordinary ability it has to adapt to this harsh environment! I have no idea what it is called. Anyone knows please tell me in the comment. :) ##Further and further: ## ## ##今天分享的是我在智利北部的阿塔卡马沙漠地带拍的花。这是地球上最干热的地方之一，整块地区全年平均降雨量只有15毫米，很多地方历史上没有任何降水。 这种细小的白花不如很多其他花朵那么鲜艳饱满，但在这种严酷的沙漠环境下，它们顽强的生命力让我不由自主地拍了好几张。 All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.text: ##Greetings everybody! Following my last post of desert flowers, today I’m presenting another type - the cactus flower. I shot these photos off the Pacific Coast of Chile, in Atacama region. As I mentioned in my last post, this area is one of the driest places in the world. I was totally burned traveling through the Atacama, but at the same time very impressed by the wild beauty of this vast land and the tenacious vitality of the thriving plants such as these cacti and their flowers. ##这是我在南美智利的阿塔卡马沙漠地带拍的仙人掌花。上一篇说到这里是地球上最干旱的地方之一，有些区域历史上从来没有过一滴降水。 我跟其他几个来自世界各地的旅行爱好者用了十几天时间穿越了这片沙漠，被晒成黑人。虽然极度干热，蜕皮好几层，但那原始无际的自然美景和人类、动植物在这片荒原上的顽强生存真的很让人惊叹，绝对不虚此行。 All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 This page is synchronized from the post: ‘#234 Desert Flowers (2)  | 沙漠之花（二）’ document.querySelectorAll('.not-gallery-item') .forEach(el => { if (!el.dataset.src) { return; } const img = document.createElement('img'); img.style = 'display:none !important;'; img.src = el.dataset.src; img.addEventListener('error', () => { img.remove(); el.style.color = 'inherit'; el.style.backgroundImage = 'none'; el.style.background = 'none'; }); img.addEventListener('load', () => { img.remove(); }); document.body.appendChild(img); });

posts.title: #235 Tulipa Cummins 🌷| 郁金香
posts.text: ##When I visited the famous Dutch garden Keukenhof during spring time, various types of gorgeous flowers were blooming. So I had a feast to my eyes and camera cards. :) This ravishing fringed tulip in my photo is called Tulipa Cummins. The classic goblet shape and violet purple tint are not uncommon. What caught my attention was its finely incised snow-white edges. I focused on its extravagantly fringed petals when shooting, since this unique feature made it stand out from other types of tulips. Its ornate fringe comes from mutations in tulips of different categories. Tulipa Cummins usually bloom at mid to late spring, and they stay vibrant pretty long in the garden and vase. ##看到@kelvinzhang发了在荷兰库肯霍夫花园拍的绣球花，想起我在那里看到的各种花。 这次分享的是一种叫“康明斯”的郁金香，鲜黄的花蕊、紫红的花瓣和雪白的锯齿状边缘让它从花丛中脱颖而出，成功抓住我的眼球和镜头。 我拍照时聚焦在它别具一格的花瓣末端上，调大光圈虚化了绿叶和后面的几朵花。这种郁金香一般在春天的中期到晚期开花，不管是种在土里还是插在水中，都能持续鲜艳挺长一段时间，好看又好养。 去年发过对库肯霍夫花园的介绍和那里的白色郁金香： My previous post and photos about Keukenhof garden and the flowers: The Story of Tulip Mania | 郁金香泡沫的故事: ##还有白玫瑰和白雏菊： ## All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 This page is synchronized from the post: ‘#235 Tulipa Cummins | 郁金香’ document.querySelectorAll('.not-gallery-item') .forEach(el => { if (!el.dataset.src) { return; } const img = document.createElement('img'); img.style = 'display:none !important;'; img.src = el.dataset.src; img.addEventListener('error', () => { img.remove(); el.style.color = 'inherit'; el.style.backgroundImage = 'none'; el.style.background = 'none'; }); img.addEventListener('load', () => { img.remove(); }); document.body.appendChild(img); });

posts.title: #236 Schwabenpfännle 🍛😋 | 真好吃
posts.text: ##I had a delicious meal in a local specialty restaurant in Überlingen, a German city on the northern shore of Lake Constance. It’s called Schwabenpfännle (the fourth choice on their menu below) - grilled pork fillets with mushroom sauce, spätzle and lettuce salad. Although the yellow egg noodles (Spätzle) themselves didn’t have much taste, they soaked the rich mushroom and meat gravy to offer very satisfying bites. ## ## ##Except for southern Germany and Austria, Spätzle is also found in the cuisines of Switzerland, Hungary, Alsace, Moselle and South Tyrol. Literally meaning “little sparrows” in German, it is a kind of pasta made with fresh eggs. Spätzle doesn’t only accompany meat dishes, but also act as a primary ingredient in other types of food. For instance, I tried Spätzle in soup when traveling in Hungary and ate it sweet with sugar and cinnamon in Alsace. ## ##Address: ##It’s also my entry to Qurator’s Tasty Tuesday competition and Photocircle’s 11th PC-Food photo contest. If you love food and photgraphy, check out these contests and join the fun! Have you tried Schwabenpfännle or Spätzle before? posts.title: #239 DIY with Donica: Make a Silver Ring 🔨💍| 自己打造银戒指
posts.text: ##Greetings everyone! I once joined a metalworking workshop in Antwerp and made a silver ring. Yeah, Antwerp is known as a diamond city, but a plain silver ring is much cheaper and easier to make. ;) Here are the steps I followed: ##大家周末好~ 这次分享的是我在安特卫普的一家金属手工作坊学习打造银戒指的过程。从不规则银条开始，到最后打磨为成品，自己手作戒指真是充满乐趣和成就感呀~ :) ## ##1.Cut off a silver strip and flatten the rough edges with a hand file. 2.Put that precious piece of silver bar into acid bath for cleaning. 3.Hammer the silver bar into a round(ish) shape - not an easy job, but so much fun to try this for the first time! :D 4.Solder the open silver round strip with another tiny piece of silver to close the loop. This brazing requires quite some skills and patience. I wouldn’t have achieved it without the experienced master’s help. 5.Then it comes to the most time and energy consuming part! I had to hammer the silver loop hard over a mandrel to make it more round and get the nice facets. So the whole workshop room was filled with the beautiful hammering soundsnoises for a long time (not only from me, but also from other enthusiastic apprentices. ;D) After the hard work of hammering, my ring formed some unique metal facets. Then I used the sand paper (in the middle picture 5) to deburr the edges. 6.At last, polish the ring with a polishing wheel. ##So that’s it! My handmade, one of a kind silver ring is born! ## ## ##Except for the fun and joy of making it by myself, I especially like the shiny metal facets from the aaaaarduous hammering. ;) It gives a special personal touch to the ring. To me, it’s more valuable than even a diamond ring. Do you like it too? Have you tried doing metal work or making other crafts by yourself? posts.title: #240 Exciting desert trip ahead! 🏜 🐫 | 撒哈拉向我招手~
posts.text: ##This is Valle de la Luna (Moon Valley) in the Atacama Desert region of northern Chile. Its barren terrain is not so friendly for living, but I was totally smitten by its unique wild beauty when traveling there. Known for its moonlike landscape, this valley is located within Los Flamencos National Reserve. The warm-toned rolling dunes, rugged mountains and special rock formations all attract visitors from afar. From the nearby town of San Pedro de Atacama, you can hike or bike along the trails leading to the valley. Deserts are not so deadly dead as I imagined. ;) On the contrary, they are pretty enchanting. So after visiting some deserts in different parts of our beautiful earth, I have been charmed to crave for more (despite being deadly burned ;p). And I’m going to the Sahara soon! Woohoo~ can’t wait! What about you? Have you been impressed by deserts in your travels? What deserts do you recommend to travel to? ##The head image is my entry to Qurator’s Photo Friday competition. posts.text: ##If you have been to Cusco of Peru, you might have visited the famous site of Sexywoman (Saqsaywaman). It is a citadel on the northern outskirts of the Inca Empire’s historic capital. At the site, I tried sliding down the massive stone slopes, just like what the boy’s doing in my photos. I loved the changing emotions shown clearly on his face. :) Imagine the thrill and fun we had at this amazing natural playground of the Inca! This collage is my entry to @ntopaz’s Emotive Art contest. Below are the 2 original photos: ##Here’s how the stone slides look like. Apparently the boy enjoyed it and couldn’t wait to have more. ;) ##如果你去过秘鲁的印加古都库斯科，可能也去看了北郊有名的Saqsaywaman遗址。如果你还没去过，将来记得去试试这里的天然大石梯！ 就像我照片中的小男孩一样，我也沿着这石头坡滑下去，很有意思的体验～ 不知道古代的印加人是不是也常常在此寻欢作乐，哈哈。 迅速下滑的过程中，耳边风飕飕而过，那种既有点恐惧又极度兴奋的快感交织，明明白白地写在了这个小男孩的脸上。:) All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.text: ##This is the view of Tétouan from a hilltop. As you can see from my photos, white buildings clustered on the side of the verdant Riff mountains, with some red, yellow and green roofs. ## ##Tétouan is one of the two major Mediterranean ports of Morocco and is the administrative capital of the country’s Spanish zone. posts.title: #246 Beef Tajine 🍲😋 | 牛肉塔吉锅
posts.text: ##This is the beef Tajine I had yesterday in Morocco. The dried apricots and prunes added a sweet taste to it, and they were a perfect match to the soft succulent beef. Scoop up the rich tasty gravy with the bread aside - it’s simply heaven! :) ## ##Tajine is a popular dish primarily prepared in the Middle East and North Africa. It’s named after the shallow earthen pot in which it is cooked. In North Africa it is called a Tajine/Tagine, while in the Middle East it is called a maraq (meaning broth) or a qidra (the cooking pot). ## ##As there are quite a lot of Moroccan immigrants in Belgium, restaurants that serve Tajine can also be found there. I tried beef and chicken Tajine before a few times, but it’s my first time in Morocco. They have always been such a hearty delight to enjoy. =) ##Beautiful decorative pots I found on the street: ##What about you? Have you tried Tajine? Do you like it? It’s my entry to @qurator’s Tasty Tuesday competition. Join the fun too if you like food and photography! ##这是昨天在摩洛哥北部小城得土安吃的塔吉锅。牛肉松软鲜嫩，白芝麻的香气在空中飘散，杏仁和西梅干的丝丝甜味融入别样的阿拉伯风情，用面包蘸点浓浓的汤汁，吃到嘴里回味无穷。^^ 塔吉锅是北非中东比较普遍的主食，名字来源于烹饪的容器，在中东称呼有所不同。因为比利时有不少摩洛哥移民，以前也吃过几次鸡肉和牛肉塔吉锅，在本土还是第一次尝试。 这次上菜时没有像有些餐馆一样，把那标志性的尖尖的锅盖（上图有我街拍的容器）也一起端上来，然后服务生充满仪式感地揭开锅盖放在旁边，让你在蒸腾上升的热气中咽着口水，从一片朦胧中张望那盘诱人的美食。:) All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.text: Inspired by @kus-knee’s Show Me a Sign contest, I’ve digged out an old picture from my phone and will also present you another sign photo freshly taken in my current trip. ## ##The first picture here was shot in Castro, a city on Chiloé Island in Chile. It’s known for its colorful wooden stilt houses (palafitos) and churches. I loved this quiet and peaceful place that had so many creative and unique architectures to offer. This sign is of a Chilean style Cevichería restaurant, and oh how I miss the Peruvian ceviches! I had the fresh delicious treat almost every week when living in Chile ~ Qué rico! :) The simple sign adds a playful touch to the traditional wooden house, and its name and the fish indicate the restaurant’s signature dish, the typical element of Chilotan architecture palafitos, and its location right by the Pacific Ocean. ## ##Here’s another sign ( actually 2 if you also count the one behind) I just captured when visiting Chefchaouen. It’s a colorful place as well but much more touristic. It’s in the Rif Mountains of northwest Morocco and is known for the old town’s blue-painted buildings. posts.title: #249 Snapshots of Structures | 菲斯住处随拍
posts.text: ##Greetings everyone! I’m still traveling in Morocco and sharing some shots snapped at the place I stayed in Fez. Full of old-world charm, Fez is often referred to as Morocco’s cultural capital, and is famous for its walled medina with medieval Marinid architecture. From the 13th to the 15th century, the country was ruled by Marinid, a Sunni Muslim dynasty of Zenata Berber descent. The elaborate structures, ornate decorations and intricate details in this place are just amazing. They look different from the previous few riads I stayed in other towns of Morocco. Though it’s not my kind of style, I was impressed and kept wondering how much time and labor had been devoted into building and restoring this stunning palace. ##这里分享些我在摩洛哥菲斯古城住处内部拍的照片。菲斯历史悠久，常被称作摩洛哥的文化之都，尤其是旧城，处处散发着古朴神秘的韵味。 这家旅馆就位于旧城，由古老的宫殿改建而成。这些繁复精美的建筑结构和装饰跟之前在其他地方呆过的几家riad(庭院老屋)有所不同，虽然不是我喜欢的风格，但还是很让人惊叹。我边转边拍，不住地感慨，建造和修缮这些杰作该是投入了多少时间和劳力呀。 ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ##.jpg) ##.jpg) ## ##.jpg) ## ## ## ## All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #250 Another Girl Feeding Cats | 喂猫的摩洛哥女孩 - People Photography by Worldcapture Week #24
posts.text: ##What’s up fellow Steemians! Here are some photos I took last week in Chefchaouen of Morocco. The head image is my entry for the People Photography contest by @worldcapture. This little girl was feeding a bunch of stray cats at a street corner, and I couldn’t help recording her sweetness. Chefchaouen is a very touristic town as I expected. Honestly, I was not really impressed by its so-called dreamy blue, but the little heart-warming moments like this made the trip worth it. To show you the girl feeding the kittens and the famous blue-painted old town of Chefchaouen, I’m also posting the other 2 pictures of her I shot that day. Hope you enjoy them like I did! :) ## ## ##这是我上周在摩洛哥北部的舍夫沙万拍到的当地小女孩喂猫的场景。舍夫沙万是有名的蓝色小镇，最近几年在Ins等图片社交媒体上火到不行，极度商业化也是意料之中，但因为正好位于南下途中，就拨出一天来经过体会一下，果然十分聒噪。;) 什么“蓝色的梦幻”倒真没觉得，而这些街头偶遇的温馨却让我不虚此行。 想起前年刚加入Steem时发过另一个小女孩喂猫的照片，一个在土耳其，一个在摩洛哥，一东一西，同为穆斯林国家，同为街角暖心的小女孩。=) ##I named it “another girl” because it reminds me of the similar scene I captured before in Turkey. I posted the “Syrian Girl Feeding a Cat” in 2017 when I just joined Steem: I’ve traveled quite extensively to over 60 countries and have taken numerous candid street photos, and this one remains one of my favorites. I was walking on a street in Istanbul that day and captured this beautiful loving moment. The street vendor nearby told me this is a Syrian refugee girl who is sometimes seen begging for food on that street, and I was lucky to witness her feeding a cat with the food she just got. ## All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #251 European Territory on African Soil | 非洲大陆上的欧洲小城
posts.text: ##After crossing the Strait of Gibraltar from the Spanish mainland, I reached the port of Ceuta. So was I in an African town already? Not really. Technically I was still in European Union. Ceuta is not a town of any African country, but a Spanish autonomous city on the north coast of Africa. It’s sharing a land border with M’diq-Fnideq Prefecture in Morocco. Together with another Spanish enclave Melilla on the northern shores of Morocco’s Mediterranean coast, they form the EU’s only land borders with Africa. ## ##坐轮渡从欧洲经直布罗陀海峡来到非洲后，这Ceuta是落脚的第一个小城。虽然脚踩在非洲大陆的土地上，这里却是西班牙的属地。 Ceuta和另一座西属小城Melilla嵌在摩洛哥以北的地中海岸，共同组成了欧盟和非洲的陆上边界。就像法国最北端和英国隔海相望的加莱港一样，这里也是非洲移民难民奔向新天地的重要通道。两地也都是高墙林立、戒备森严。 本打算直接往南走，跨越国界去摩洛哥，但下船后看到这个小城还挺迷人，正好天气也给力，晴空万里、碧蓝如洗，似乎都在召唤我的双脚，就决定先在这里逛逛再走。这些照片就是瞎逛时拍下的。 ## ## ##It was a gorgeous sunny day. Blue sky and no clouds. The original plan was to go on to the south to cross the border, but the beautiful weather and cityscape attracted me to explore a bit here. So I strolled a couple of hours in this small town and snapped some shots. The beach was nice and quiet with only a few sunbathers. If I was not mistaken, there were much more sea urchins in the crystal clear water than humans . ;) ## ## ## ##Due to its strategic location, Ceuta had been an important naval base since Carthaginian and Roman times. Its early form of fortification since the 5th century was strengthened by the Portuguese in the 1540s. Today, part of the Royal Walls including the ditch and bastions remain intact. After the restoration in recent years, they have been open to the public. I walked around this heritage site oozing with history where the past battle scenes seemed to be replaying. ## ## Ceuta was actually acquired from Portugal by Spain at the end of the Iberian Union in 1640 when the 2 countries had the same King, and it served as a free port till Spain joined the EU. Later I saw a large number of Moroccans crossing the border from their country to shop and work here, and then return to Morocco in the evening. I didn’t see anyone climbing the wired fence over the border, but there’s news report about it and the crackdown of attempts to illegally emmigrate to Europe seeking for a better life. ## ## ## ## ## ##蔚蓝的天空澄澈的海水自由翱翔的鸟欢快游弋的鱼 黄白相间的建筑群生机盎然的仙人掌战火纷飞的争夺史年代久远的古城墙 如今看不见硝烟的边界处高墙上爬满锋利的铁丝网 ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## ## All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #252 Flying Flower 🦋 | 蝶恋花
posts.text: The butterfly is a flying flower, the flower a tethered butterfly. ~Ponce Denis Écouchard Lebrun ## ##So I saw this flying flower resting on a tethered butterfly in a nature park in Rockanje, the southern Netherlands. This tranquil green place is by the sea, not far from the city Rotterdam. The close-up shot is my entry to Flamingirl’s 7 DAYS MACRO-PHOTOGRAPHY CONTEST 3  and Qurator’s Photo Friday competition. Do you like photography too? Feel free to join the fun! :) Here are another 2 photos of the same butterfly, not so macro as the first one, but to show you a bigger picture of its environment and the different angles. ## ## ##这是我在荷兰南部的一个自然保护区里拍到的蝴蝶。 一位法国诗人曾写到： 蝴蝶是舞动的花儿，花儿是挽住的蝴蝶。 ##想起中国古代也有很多以“蝶恋花”为词牌名的绝妙好词，记得小时候被逼背过不少，当时并不完全理解那些情绪，只是为了交差而机械背诵句子和解释。而现在说汉语的机会不多，回头再读，总觉得中文真是太美，寥寥数句，却内涵丰富、意蕴悠远。印象中背诵过的有《蝶恋花·庭院深深深几许》、《蝶恋花·昨夜秋风来万里》、《蝶恋花·画阁归来春又晚》等。这里附上我最喜欢的两首： ## 蝶恋花 | 柳永 >伫倚危楼风细细，望极春愁，黯黯生天际。草色烟光残照里，无言谁会凭阑意。拟把疏狂图一醉，对酒当歌，强乐还无味。衣带渐宽终不悔，为伊消得人憔悴。 蝶恋花 · 春景 | 苏轼 花褪残红青杏小。燕子飞时，绿水人家绕。枝上柳绵吹又少，天涯何处无芳草！墙里秋千墙外道。墙外行人，墙里佳人笑。笑渐不闻声渐悄，多情却被无情恼。 你最喜欢的蝶恋花词又是哪一首呢？ All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #255 Toxic? | 毒蘑菇 My entry for the 🐜 7 DAYS MACRO-PHOTOGRAPHY CONTEST 3 🐜
posts.text: Following my last post, here’s another photo I took as my entry to the 7 DAYS MACRO-PHOTOGRAPHY CONTEST 3  hosted by @flamingirl. My first impression of this bright red mushroom dotted with white spots might come from the classic Super Mario Bros, and the mushroom house of Smurfs. :) And I did spot this mushroom in Belgium, birth place of the famous Smurfs. ## ##This type of mushroom is called Amanita muscaria — commonly known as fly agaric, or fly amanita. Though considered toxic to humans, the compound muscimol it contains could make people feel less anxious and more relaxed. So the fly agaric has been used in religious practices for their hallucinogenic properties, especially in Siberia. That’s why it has been associated with the rituals of northern European and Asiatic shamans. ##A few more I found at the same place: ## ## ##这些颜色鲜艳的蘑菇是我在离住处不远的一片草地上看到的。红底白点的毒蝇伞（蛤蟆菌）似乎是毒蘑菇的经典代表？它所含的蝇蕈醇具有镇静安眠和刺激精神的效果，在一些国家的民间被作为安眠药物。它的致幻功能还常被西伯利亚和北欧的一些巫师用来通灵。据说有些地区会用这种蘑菇来毒死苍蝇、老鼠等动物，德国还有人把它们浸入酒中来治风湿痛。 回想起来，我对这种蘑菇的最初印象似乎来自小时候痴迷的游戏超级马利奥，还有蓝精灵们住的可爱蘑菇房。而《蓝精灵》也正是诞生于比利时，去年正好是它们的60周年生日，布鲁塞尔还举办了一系列的展览庆祝活动。 All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #257 Dorado with Crab Risotto 🍛😋| 海鲤蟹肉饭
posts.text: ##Hey everyone, here’s a meal I had last weekend - Dorado fish with crab risotto and asparagus. It’s my entry for the Tasty Tuesday competition by @qurator. ##上周末吃的海鲤蟹肉饭，里面还搭配了三种芦笋 - 常见的绿芦笋、见不得光长在地下的白芦笋和口感爽脆的海芦笋。眼前满满一盘子的春天~ :) ## ##The Dorado fish meat is tender and a bit sweet. It is low on fat and pretty firm in texture. Its mild flavor goes very well with the more salty and rich crab risotto underneath. The crunchy marsh samphire (glasswort, sea bean, pickleweed, picklegrass) and the two types of asparagus add a fresh taste to the dish. You can smell the spring! The white asparagus has a hint of bitterness and is softer than the green one. It’s also more expensive as a result of the more time-consuming growing method. They have to be buried underground to avoid any sunlight which would turn them green. I personally prefer the grassy green asparagus than the more fibrous white one. What about you? posts.title: #258 Street Fashion 👘👴 | 街头长袍 Entry for Peoplephotography and Portrait Contest
posts.text: ##This elderly man was walking in front of me in the medina of Tétouan, Morocco. He’s wearing a Fez hat and a traditional long robe djellaba which is commonly seen in the Maghreb region of North Africa. This type of robe is usually made of either cotton for summer wear or coarse wool for the winter. I’ve frequently seen flocks of sheep when traveling in the surrounding Atlas mountains where the wool is typically obtained. The baggy hood with a point at the back can protect the wearer from the sun, the snow and rain or the sand blown by strong desert wind. It’s not a typical street fashion by an urban youth (though in recent years quite a lot of designers have been inspired by these robes to create modern kaftans), but this local man in the traditional wear just blends perfectly with the charming old streets. What do you think? The head image is my entry to @worldcapture’s People Photography Contest week #24. Below is the photo in original colors joining the @portraitcontest themed Fashion. ## ##漫步在摩洛哥北部山城得土安的老城区，看到前面这位当地老人，手里提着刚从旁边的菜市场买来的食材，身穿起源本国的北非传统长袍，头戴平顶菲斯圆毡帽，跟周边的老街和谐地融为一体。 这种长袍通常有冬夏两种，夏天穿的由轻薄的棉布做成，冬装的原料是粗糙些的羊毛，来自周边的阿特拉斯山区，我在山里走时常常能看到成群的绵羊和牧羊人。上面连着的宽大尖帽子可以遮阳挡雨、御寒防沙，在这离沙漠不远的气候多变的山区很实用。 不少国际知名的服装设计师，尤其是法国人（摩洛哥曾是法国殖民地），从这类北非传统长袍中汲取灵感，创新出更多款式的现代版长袍长裙，在时装界挺受欢迎。 ##Cityscape of Tétouan | 俯瞰摩洛哥北部小城 Traditional Clothing in Peru’s Colca Canyon | 秘鲁大峡谷山民的传统服装长什么样？ All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #259 Getting Closer to the Sahara 🏜🧕 | 秒变柏柏尔人
posts.text: ##So this is my look on the way to the almighty Sahara dunes. :D The blue tagelmust on my head was bought from a Berber vendor at the roadside. It is an indigo-dyed cotton garment that acts as both a veil (see my second photo below) and a turban. He told me the blue’s a lucky color for the Berber men in the desert. Ok, though I’m neither a Berber nor a man, this long piece of fabric was pretty handy to shield the incredibly strong wind, scorching sun and spreading sand. I’m glad that I went local, and the color scheme of my outfit was even in line with the environment. :) ##At first I looked like this: ##I saw the theme of this week’s @portraitcontest is Fashion, so I’d like to join it too, but I’m not sure if it qualifies? It’s not a typical fashion shot in a studio. No fancy dress, no fine makeup, no artificial lighting… just a portrait of me in some Berber fashion and with genuine smile. I didn’t act cool like a model as the surrounding nature was way cooler… ;) All of a sudden these “wise” words popped up in my mind: How do you get a beach body?Have a body + go to the beach ##Actually the blueish lake behind me is more impressive than my blue turban, isn’t it? It’s a reservoir close to Errachidia. Once again, I was impressed by the joined force of our Mother Nature and the humans. The reservoir is called Lake Hassan Eddakhil. It is situated at Foum Rhour on the Ziz river in Morocco’s Tafilalet province. Construction work on the dam was conducted from 1968 to 1971, in order to regularise the wadi to develop the agriculture in the Ziz valley, as well as to provide flood protection. But as always, a dam also causes sustained environmental impacts. ##Zooooom ooooout and ooooout: ## ## ## All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #261 Royal Palace of Cambodia & A Korean Meal 🇰🇭 | 柬埔寨皇宫和附近韩餐
posts.text: ##Hey, what’s up fellow Steemians! What you see in my photos here are part of the Royal Palace of Cambodia in its capital city Phnom Penh. The head image is my entry to the Qurator Photo Friday competition. 今天请大家跟随我的脚步，来看看位于首都金边的一部分柬埔寨皇宫。 ## ##It’s the moment before a tropical shower when the changing sky and clouds casted a dramatic backdrop for these buildings. The girl in the picture was cycling hard to escape the coming storm, and the heavy rain started to pour when I walked fast till a restaurant by the square. The fried chicken restaurant franchise is called Bonchon Chicken. They are commonly seen in Southeast Asia and the USA, but there’s only 1 store in its birthplace of South Korea. So I ordered a coffee and a Bibimbap while waiting for the rain to stop. I’m not sure if the meal was genuinely Korean, but it tasted great and this place offered a nice view point for the palace and the square. 拍这前几张照片时，正好赶上狂风大作、乌云压城。路上的行人都加快了脚步，那位骑车的妹纸也开始猛踩踏板，拼命想躲过即将来临的大雨。果然，等我一路小跑到前面一家小餐馆时，立刻暴雨倾盆。 而这家叫Bonchon的韩式连锁餐厅的位置和环境都不错，是个看风景躲雨的好地方，值得推荐。这餐馆主打炸鸡，在东南亚和美国见到不少，据说它起源于釜山，在本土却只开了一家，看来是个墙内开花墙外香的典型呀。我不禁想到熊猫快餐、左宗棠鸡、幸运饼干这类吃的，哈哈…… 其实开始只打算喝点东西躲个雨，结果雨一直下个不停，奶茶、咖啡都喝完了还没有停的迹象。我都等饿了，只好又点了份石锅拌饭。看上去应该不是韩国人做的，而是统一培训出来的，但味道还可以，咖啡的花也拉得挺熟练~ ##.jpg) ##.jpg) Address: 地址： ##View from the upstairs of the Korean restaurant: 从餐馆楼上看出去： ##.jpg) ##About 2 hours later, the downpour stopped, and locals went on picnicing. This square and the river side seemed to be a popular place for tourists as well as the locals to relax. 过了两个小时左右，雨终于停了，很多当地人也陆续冒出来，继续席地野餐： .jpg) ##The whole complex covers an extensive area of 174,870 square metres. Its throne hall, defensive wall, Temple of the Emerald Buddha, stupas and towering spires are all typical elements of Khmer architecture with a slight French touch. ## ##In the mid-19th century, the construction of the palace started after the royal capital was relocated here from Oudong. The site was chosen at the Western bank of the cross division of the two important rivers - Mekong River and Tonle Sap River. ## ##The Kings of Cambodia have lived in the palace since it was built except for the period of the Khmer Rouge. ##Have you visited the Royal Palace of Cambodia? What impressed you the most there? posts.title: #260 Lighthouse & Beach 🇧🇷 | 灯塔和海滩
posts.text: ##Hello my friends, how’s your weekend going? My schedule is pretty full and I’ve been having a neck pain these days, so I’m not writing much today but just posting some photos from my phone. I’m going to show you a beautiful spot I visited in Salvador, Brazil. These pictures were shot close to Farol da Barra Lighthouse at the southern tip of the colorful coastal city. Originally built at Santo António Fort in the 1690s, this site has been long attracting visitors together with its charming surroundings. It is open to visitors from 9am to 6pm except for Monday, but you can come enjoy the nice beach, the sea breeze and the scenic views with slender palm trees  anytime you want. I loved the brilliant sunset over the lighthouse, and oh how I miss the huge fresh coconuts! 便 :) ##今天通过几张照片向大家展示一下巴西北部古城萨尔瓦多最南端的一处景点。题图里的巴拉灯塔最初建于17世纪90年代，现在它和附近的海滩成为市民和游客休闲放松的好去处。 如果你来到这里，随便走走、吹吹海风、看看日落，都自有一番舒心惬意。还有记得尝试下小摊上又甜又便宜的椰子水，一个巨大的椰子折合人民币只要三块钱！当然如果你也有当地人的爬树本领，直接去摘个椰子也行～ All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 This page is synchronized from the post: ‘#260 Lighthouse & Beach  | 灯塔和海滩’ document.querySelectorAll('.not-gallery-item') .forEach(el => { if (!el.dataset.src) { return; } const img = document.createElement('img'); img.style = 'display:none !important;'; img.src = el.dataset.src; img.addEventListener('error', () => { img.remove(); el.style.color = 'inherit'; el.style.backgroundImage = 'none'; el.style.background = 'none'; }); img.addEventListener('load', () => { img.remove(); }); document.body.appendChild(img); });

posts.title: #263 Laksa! 🍜 | 叻沙!
posts.text: Hi everyone! It’s Tasty Tuesday time! I devoured a big bowl of Laksa last Sunday evening in the Chinatown ( only a short street) of Antwerp. It reminds me of those delicious Laksas I enjoyed in Malaysia and Singapore. ##上周日晚在安特卫普的唐人街吃了一大碗叻沙，让我想起在马来西亚和新加坡大饕叻沙的日子。叻沙是马来语Laksa的发音，是道起源于马来西亚的面食料理，相信大马和新加坡的朋友们肯定非常熟悉，因为这和椰浆饭、炒粿条等都是新马的美食代表，在那边的街头随处可见，主要有咖哩叻沙、亚三叻沙等口味。 ##In my picture above, it is a Laksa I had in 328 Katong Laksa on the East Coast Road of Singapore. In a 2013 cooking showdown, 328 Katong Laksa beat the celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay. This result surely made it even more famous. The Laksa was inspired by the Straits Chinese who live in the precinct of Katong. I quickly finished the aromatic seafood and rice vermicelli soaked in the spicy broth flavoured with coconut milk and dried shrimp. It tasted divine! ## ##And I loved the Laksa from Toast Box, but I forgot to take pictures of the food there since I simply ate too many Laksas those days, so only a Laksa photo from the shop when I left: ;) .jpg) ##Though we can find Laksa easily in Malaysia and Singapore, it’s rare here in Belgium. There are only 3 to 4 Malaysian restaurants in the whole country (I haven’t tried the 4th one yet as I can’t find any pictures of it online but only a name and address, would check it out one day), and not every one of them sells Laksa. Luckily Belgium is small in size, so I’m grateful to enjoy some hearty Asian meals occasionally without driving too far. :) ## ##As for the precious Laksa here, it’s normal that there’s not a variety of choices like Nyonya Laksa, Johor Laksa, Sarawak Laksa, Penang Asam Laksa… but only the most common curry mee with coconut-based curry broth. I feel this is the more mild flavored Laksa comparing to other types I tried in Malaysia? Any Malaysian or Singaporean Steemians please correct me if I got it wrong. ## ##As you can see from my photos, the toppings include prawns, fish cakes/balls, tofu puffs, bean sprouts, long beans, scallions, eggplants, and even char siu (Cantonese barbecue pork) pieces… It’s rich and fragrant as always. Slurp, slurp, slurp~ ## ##I just found these pictures from my phone taken in Kuala Lumpur - similar noodle soup I had in the cafe restaurant chain Old Town White Coffee. posts.text: ##Greetings everybody! Here’s my second entry to the Art of Love contest hosted by @ntopaz and @livvu. It’s a collage of 7 photos that I took from around the world. Hmmm, looked like a nice algorithm… And it reminded me again to do this shit post to embrace the cool new kid in town. :) So here we go, let me present you this precious poop photo I took earlier this month in the Sahara. posts.title: #272 Smallest Republic? (1) 🇱🇹 | 最小共和国？(一)
posts.text: ##The Partiko Cityscape Photography Contest and @axeman’s amazing shots of the Lithuanian coast remind me of my trip to Lithuania many years ago. I’ve visited almost all EU countries, among which the Baltic states are the first few ones. I guess I’m kind of weird, as most people would first go to places like Paris and Rome when they visit Europe. But I found these Baltic countries pretty enchanting. In this post I’d love to share with you some information about Užupis, one of the world’s smallest republics in the middle of the Lithuanian capital. The Republic of Užupis only covers less than 1 square km within Vilnius, but it has its own president, constitution, bishop and even two churches. ## ##The guide of the walk tour told us Užupis means “behind the river” in Lithuanian. You can see a bit of “the river” Vilnelė in my photo here ;). Used to be the city’s poorest and roughest area during the former Soviet Union time, this unique republic now attracts more and more visitors. Like in many art districts of the big cities around the world, artists came first for the cheap accommodation, and eventually transformed the neighborhoods into a vibrant creative community. Nowadays, it hosts various events like exhibitions, concerts, fashion festivals and poetry evenings. ##This is my entry to the cityscape (or countryscape in this case? ;p) photo contest, posted with @partiko on my phone, and I’ll share more photos and info about this artistic republic in my coming post. So stay tuned and see you soon! ##Posted using Partiko iOS All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for reading. Please tell me what you think in the comments. posts.title: #274 Eternity-Buddha in Nirvana | 永生–涅槃佛
posts.text: Greetings everyone! Inspired by @kus-knee’s “The Weird is Good Art Contest”, I’m showing you a piece of artwork I saw last year. It was displayed at the Triennial exhibition in the Melbourne NGV (National Gallery of Victoria), Australia’s oldest public art museum. The exhibition was showcasing contemporary artworks of over 100 artists and designers from 32 countries. ## ##This sculptural installation was created by Chinese artist Xu Zhen, a leading figure among the younger contemporary artists in China. He is also a curator and entrepreneur, having worked across photography, video, painting and performance art. Except for the replication of the famous reclining buddha statue here, you can see different sculptural figures from Greek and Roman mythology on and around it. The entire work is over 15 metres long. ## ##Xu Zhen explored his Buddhist heritage and attempted to address barriers by bringing Eastern and Western cultural traditions together. In his own words: I have always been curious about the differences between cultures and the alienation between them. And yet, misconceptions can be the beginning of awareness and understanding. I actually feel the same. What do you think of this artwork? Have you seen any cross-culture artworks that you would love to share? ## ##I once did a post about another artwork from the same exhibition:以前发过篇同一展览中一个日本艺术团体的作品： A Magical Light Show of Vortices Created by Movement 酷炫奇幻的漩涡光影秀 ## ##今天分享的是在墨尔本的维州国立美术馆NGV看到的一件中国艺术家的雕塑作品：徐震的《永生 – 涅槃佛》。 NGV是澳洲历史最悠久的公共艺术馆，这场持续5个月的三年展占据了整个国际馆的四层楼，来自世界各地100多位艺术家的作品不仅让我大饱眼福，也让我有机会亲身体验了很多有意思的交互展品。包括前沿技术、建筑、动画、表演、电影、绘画、素描、时尚设计、挂毯和雕塑等。其中还有另外一位中国设计师的作品：郭培设计的高级定制礼服。 徐震特别为这次NGV三年展创作了这件雕塑作品，在著名的唐代大卧佛身上还有四周，有很多古希腊古罗马的经典雕塑：垂死的高卢人、法尔内塞赫拉克勒斯、夜、昼、受伤的阿喀琉斯、波斯战士、酒神女祭司、克里斯托弗·德的陵墓雕塑、跳舞的农牧之神、蹲着的阿弗洛狄忒、那耳喀索斯、垂死的斯巴达、坠落的伊卡洛斯、河流、克罗托的米罗。 这件宏大的雕塑总长超过15米，结合了东西方的宗教经典，试图探索文化差异，寻求沟通和对话。徐震说自己一直对文化间的差别和异化充满好奇，而迷思则可以作为认知和理解的开端。你对此又是怎么看的呢？ All content by @itchyfeetdonica图文 by Donica多 Thank you for reading.
